title: Rewrite the problem
text: First rewrite the problem using a rational exponent: $$\int e^x \sqrt{1+e^x} \,dx=\int \frac{e^x {\left(1+e^x\right)}^1}{2} \,dx$$
speech: First rewrite the problem using a rational exponent: ; the integral of e to the x-th, the square root of 1 plus e to the x-th end root; d x; is equal to; the integral of fraction, e to the x-th times; open paren, 1 plus e to the x-th, close paren to the first, over 2, end fraction; d x;

title: Using u-substitution
text: What is the expression of the integral after using the u-substitution?

title: Find the integral

title: Back-subsitute
text: The final step is to convert u back into the original variable $$\frac{2}{3} {\left(1+e^x\right)}^{\frac{3}{2}}+C$$
